channel.title: [Showoff]Camaro Model: Year-End School Project
channel.description:
Hey guys, just thought I would show you the outcome of my final-project as a 3D student in Highschool, so I figured I would end the year off by making a new Camaro, showing how much better I have gotten since the beginning of the year (when I was assigned a Camaro project). It goes without saying this one is much better. Hopefully this will inspire some of you beginner modelers.
Also: Excuse the quality of the scenery, it was made in 15 minutes [b]Turn Table Animation[/b]
[b]Renders[/b]
[b]Wire frame[/b]

item.title: [Showoff]Camaro Model: Year-End School Project
item.dc:creator: @Infinity_Death Infinity Death
item.description:
@Infinity_Death wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

This is sexy, whos up for making a racing game with this as one of the cars? :3

I am, I’m already currently making a game in unity 3d making a car game shouldn’t be a problem… if i had a little help with car scripts lol

Read full topic

item.title: [Showoff]Camaro Model: Year-End School Project
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:12, topic:398378”][quote author=Java Is My Bitch link=topic=495512.msg3623172#msg3623172 date=1307616486]
Very nice job, although it’s a little boxy, have you sub-surfed yet? Unless you’re going for that ps2 game look. I advise keeping that model and subsurfing, then baking a normal and texture map of the subsurfed version onto the old, low poly version.
[/quote]
This is a low poly version. I realized after the finished render I hadn’t fine-tuned the subsurfacing enough. But what can you do? Didn’t have time to render the whole animation again.[/quote]Meh, just do a still render, animations take too long.
Unless you have Renderman.

Read full topic

Looks rather need to be fair with you.

item.title: [Showoff]Camaro Model: Year-End School Project
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

Java Is My Bitch:

Very nice job, although it’s a little boxy, have you sub-surfed yet? Unless you’re going for that ps2 game look. I advise keeping that model and subsurfing, then baking a normal and texture map of the subsurfed version onto the old, low poly version.

This is a low poly version. I realized after the finished render I hadn’t fine-tuned the subsurfacing enough. But what can you do? Didn’t have time to render the whole animation again.

Read full topic

item.title: [Showoff]Camaro Model: Year-End School Project

item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

Very nice job, although it’s a little boxy, have you sub-surfed yet? Unless you’re going for that ps2 game look. I advise keeping that model and subsurfing, then baking a normal and texture map of the subsurfed version onto the old, low poly version.

item.title: [Showoff]Camaro Model: Year-End School Project
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

Strangle:

yeah, i noticed you only Textured the outsides of the rims and when i looked at Wireframe i could tell they werent hollow. makes the rims look weird.

I actually ran out of time and imported my old tires and rims and just fixed up the material and rim edges; otherwise I would have made new tires and rims completely.

Read full topic

item.title: [Showoff]Camaro Model: Year-End School Project
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

Loveandpower:

Are the mirrors supposed to look like this?

The mirrors were a five minute model, as I was near out of time. That turn-table animation took 32 hours to render

Strangle:

Those Wheels Arent hollow are they?

No, its just a bad material I forgot to change.

Read full topic
